entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 70 to 90 mm of rain, especially in the ranges. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 120 mm of rain, especially in the ranges. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h expected from Saturday evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Grey and Buller Districts split into two separate warnings due to differences in timing and rainfall amounts.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 110 to 150 mm of rain, mostly falling in 9 to 12 hours ahead of a front moving from south to north. Peak rates of 20 to 30 mm/h expected with the front. Thunderstorms possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 100 to 130 mm of rain about the main divide, and 70 to 90 mm within 15 km farther east. Peak rates of 20 to 30 mm/h expected Saturday morning about the divide. Freezing level 2400 metres. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northwesterlies gusting 130km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.
